content.text: Sudoku Helper
This workspace is an aid for playing sudoku. It determines which squares are ruled out based on the other entries in a given row, column or section of the board.

Game Board
This is a copy of the game board, so you can revert to it if you screw up. Use the other game board below to play.
This is the game board that should be edited.
Allowed Moves

This board contains the allowed moves for each square, based on the other values present in the given row, column and section. We use the function getAllowedSquareValues to find the value for each square that does not have a selection in it.
Processing
We will convert the game board above, which contains strings, to data that contains integers so it is easier to work with.
Here we have a folder function to find the allowed values for a specific square given the current game board.
getAllowedSquareValues
This page function finds the allowed values for a gameboard square given the square row and column and the game board data.

Section Info
The following functions deal with sections. That is what I am calling a 3x3 section of the board. There may be a proper name for this, but I don't know much about sudoku so I am going with this.

The naming conventions I am using is section number refers to the 3x3 square from the game board and section index refers to the sqaure within the section. The numbering/indexing starts at the top left (with 0) and increases by one as you go horizontally.
